Definition:
In this study, we want to collect alternate possibilities, i.e., hypotheses that are contrary to the facts. Specifically, we provide a short story consisting of exactly 5 sentences. You need to change a key aspect of 2nd sentence so that the story continuation changes, but leaves a still interesting short story.  Please make sure that: The new sentence is closely related to the original 2nd sentence, rather than saying a totally irrelevant thing. The new sentence changes the subsequent storyline, so that at least one of the three subsequent sentences can no longer form a consistent story. 
 Things to avoid : Note that the new sentence does not have to change the whole subsequent storyline, but just some parts of it. 
 Emphasis & Caution:

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 2: Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.
Positive Examples.output: Two dogs rushed into the store.
Positive Examples.explanation: Changed the entity “two men“ to “two dogs“. This is a good edit because it satisfies all the requirements. Note that with the new sentence, the subsequent “The men threatened ...“ in the 4th sentence no longer holds.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: Ben had a doctor's appointment. 
 Sentence 2: He was very scared. 
 Sentence 3: He never went to the doctor. 
 Sentence 4: He slowly stepped into the office. 
 Sentence 5: The doctor greeted him calmly and he felt better.
Positive Examples.output: He was in a rush to go to work after the appointment.
Positive Examples.explanation: The 4th sentence 'slowly stepped into' is not consistent with 'He was in a rush'.
